articles.title: S√•dan Undskylder Du p√• Spansk: Vejledning for Par
articles.content:
import VocabCard from '@components/VocabCard.astro';
import CultureTip from '@components/CultureTip.astro';
import PhraseOfDay from '@components/PhraseOfDay.astro';
import CTA from '@components/CTA.astro';

At kunne sige undskyld p√• din partners sprog er en af de vigtigste f√¶rdigheder i et flerkulturelt forhold. En oprigtig undskyldning p√• spansk viser ikke bare respekt ‚Äì den viser, at du virkelig forst√•r og v√¶rds√¶tter din partner. I denne guide l√¶rer du de vigtigste undskyldningsfraser p√• spansk, fra simple "undskyld" til dybf√∏lte forsoningsord. Tjek ogs√• vores guide til [spanske k√¶lenavne](/learn/da/es/spanish-pet-names-and-endearments/) for at afrunde jeres romantiske ordforr√•d.

<PhraseOfDay
  word="Lo siento mucho"
  translation="Jeg er virkelig ked af det"
  pronunciation="lo syen-to moo-cho"
  context="Den mest oprigtige undskyldning p√• spansk"
/>

## De Grundl√¶ggende Undskyldninger

F√∏r vi dykker ned i de mere komplekse undskyldninger, lad os mestre de basale fraser:

<VocabCard
  word="Lo siento"
  translation="Undskyld"
  pronunciation="lo syen-to"
  example="Lo siento, llegu√© tarde."
/>

| Spansk | Dansk | Udtale | Hvorn√•r bruges |
|---------|-------|--------|----------------|
| **Lo siento** | Undskyld | lo syen-to | Daglige sm√• fejl |
| **Te pido perd√≥n** | Jeg undskylder | te pee-do per-don | Mere formel |
| **Perd√≥name** | Tilgiv mig | per-do-na-me | Beder om tilgivelse |
| **Fue mi culpa** | Det var min fejl | fwe mi kool-pa | Tager ansvar |
| **Me equivoqu√©** | Jeg tog fejl | me e-ki-bo-ke | Indr√∏mmer fejl |

## Dybf√∏lte Undskyldninger

N√•r en simpel undskyldning ikke er nok:

- **Lamento profundamente** (Jeg fortryder dybt) - "la-men-to pro-foon-da-men-te"
- **Nunca quise hacerte da√±o** (Jeg ville aldrig s√•re dig) - "noon-ka ki-se a-ser-te da-nyo"
- **Mereces algo mejor** (Du fortjener bedre) - "me-re-ses al-go me-hor"
- **No puedo creer que dije eso** (Jeg kan ikke tro jeg sagde det) - "no pwe-do kre-er"

<CultureTip flag="üá™üá∏" title="Undskyldningskultur">
I spansktalende kulturer er undskyldninger ofte mere emotionelle og fysiske. Et kram ledsager ofte ordene.
</CultureTip>

## Anerkend Partnerens F√∏lelser

En god undskyldning handler ogs√• om at vise forst√•else:

<VocabCard
  word="Entiendo por qu√© est√°s molesto/a"
  translation="Jeg forst√•r hvorfor du er ked af det"
  pronunciation="en-tyen-do por ke"
  example="Entiendo por qu√© est√°s enfadada."
/>

| Spansk | Dansk | Udtale |
|---------|-------|--------|
| **Entiendo por qu√© est√°s molesto/a** | Jeg forst√•r hvorfor du er ked af det | en-tyen-do por ke |
| **Tienes todo el derecho a estar enfadado/a** | Du har ret til at v√¶re vred | tye-nes to-do el de-re-cho |
| **Deber√≠a haberte escuchado** | Jeg skulle have lyttet | de-be-ri-a a-ber-te es-koo-cha-do |
| **Tus sentimientos son importantes para m√≠** | Dine f√∏lelser er vigtige | toos sen-ti-myen-tos |

## L√∏fter om Forbedring

Vis din partner at du vil g√∏re det bedre:

- **Prometo hacerlo mejor** (Jeg lover at g√∏re det bedre) - "pro-me-to a-ser-lo me-hor"
- **No volver√° a pasar** (Det sker ikke igen) - "no bol-be-ra a pa-sar"
- **Te lo compensar√©** (Jeg vil g√∏re det godt igen) - "te lo kom-pen-sa-re"
- **Estoy trabajando en m√≠ mismo/a** (Jeg arbejder p√• mig selv) - "es-toy tra-ba-han-do"

## Bede om Forsoning

<VocabCard
  word="¬øPodemos hablar de esto?"
  translation="Kan vi tale om det?"
  pronunciation="po-de-mos a-blar de es-to?"
  example="¬øPodemos hablar de lo que pas√≥?"
/>

| Spansk | Dansk | Udtale |
|---------|-------|--------|
| **¬øPodemos hablar de esto?** | Kan vi tale om det? | po-de-mos a-blar de es-to? |
| **Quiero arreglar esto juntos** | Lad os l√∏se det sammen | kye-ro a-re-glar es-to hoon-tos |
| **Dame otra oportunidad** | Giv mig en chance til | da-me o-tra o-por-too-ni-dad |
| **Empecemos de nuevo** | Lad os starte forfra | em-pe-se-mos de nwe-bo |
| **Te amo y luchar√© por nosotros** | Jeg elsker dig og vil k√¶mpe for os | te a-mo i loo-cha-re |

## Specifikke Situationer

### N√•r Du Har Glemt Noget
- **Lo siento mucho, se me olvid√≥** (Undskyld jeg glemte det)
- **D√©jame compens√°rtelo** (Lad mig g√∏re det godt igen)

### N√•r Du Har Sagt Noget S√•rende
- **No quise decir eso** (Jeg mente det ikke)
- **Habl√© por rabia** (Jeg talte i vrede)

### N√•r Du Er Kommet For Sent
- **Perdona por hacerte esperar** (Undskyld jeg lod dig vente)
- **Gracias por tu paciencia** (Tak for din t√•lmodighed)

<CultureTip flag="üá™üá∏" title="Kropssprog">
Spaniere v√¶rds√¶tter fysisk n√¶rhed ved undskyldninger. Hold √∏jenkontakt og tal med varme.
</CultureTip>

## Acceptere en Undskyldning

Det er lige s√• vigtigt at kunne acceptere en undskyldning:

| Spansk | Dansk | Udtale |
|---------|-------|--------|
| **Te perdono** | Jeg tilgiver dig | te per-do-no |
| **Est√° bien** | Det er okay | es-ta byen |
| **Olvid√©moslo** | Lad os glemme det | ol-bi-de-mos-lo |
| **Todav√≠a te amo** | Jeg elsker dig stadig | to-da-bi-a te a-mo |

## Tips til Oprigtige Undskyldninger

1. **V√¶lg det rette tidspunkt** - Undskyldig n√•r din partner er klar
2. **Se dem i √∏jnene** - √òjenkontakt viser oprigtighed
3. **Brug deres navn** - Det g√∏r det personligt
4. **F√∏lg op med handling** - Ord er kun begyndelsen

For flere kommunikationsfraser, se vores [spanske fraser for par](/learn/da/es/spanish-essential-phrases-for-couples/).

At mestre kunsten at undskylde p√• spansk vil styrke jeres forhold og vise din partner, at du tager deres sprog alvorligt.

<CTA />

articles.title: 50+ —Ä—É–º—É–Ω—Å—å–∫–∏—Ö —Ñ—Ä–∞–∑ –¥–ª—è —Ä–æ–º–∞–Ω—Ç–∏—á–Ω–æ–≥–æ –≤–µ—á–æ—Ä–∞
articles.content:
# –†—É–º—É–Ω—Å—å–∫–∞ –ª–µ–∫—Å–∏–∫–∞ –¥–ª—è —Ä–æ–º–∞–Ω—Ç–∏—á–Ω–æ–≥–æ –ø–æ–±–∞—á–µ–Ω–Ω—è

–ü–ª–∞–Ω—É—î—Ç–µ —Ä–æ–º–∞–Ω—Ç–∏—á–Ω–∏–π –≤–µ—á—ñ—Ä –∑ —Ä—É–º—É–Ω—Å—å–∫–∏–º –ø–∞—Ä—Ç–Ω–µ—Ä–æ–º? –¶—ñ —Å–ª–æ–≤–∞ —Ç–∞ —Ñ—Ä–∞–∑–∏ –∑—Ä–æ–±–ª—è—Ç—å –≤–∞—à–µ –ø–æ–±–∞—á–µ–Ω–Ω—è –Ω–µ–∑–∞–±—É—Ç–Ω—ñ–º.

## –í —Ä–µ—Å—Ç–æ—Ä–∞–Ω—ñ

### –†–µ–∑–µ—Ä–≤–∞—Ü—ñ—è —Å—Ç–æ–ª–∏–∫–∞

- **A»ô vrea sƒÉ rezerv o masƒÉ pentru doi** ‚Äî –•–æ—Ç—ñ–≤/—Ö–æ—Ç—ñ–ª–∞ –± –∑–∞–±—Ä–æ–Ω—é–≤–∞—Ç–∏ —Å—Ç–æ–ª–∏–∫ –Ω–∞ –¥–≤–æ—Ö
- **Pentru disearƒÉ / Pentru m√¢ine searƒÉ** ‚Äî –ù–∞ —Å—å–æ–≥–æ–¥–Ω—ñ—à–Ω—ñ–π / –∑–∞–≤—Ç—Ä–∞—à–Ω—ñ–π –≤–µ—á—ñ—Ä
- **O masƒÉ lini»ôtitƒÉ, vƒÉ rog** ‚Äî –¢–∏—Ö–∏–π —Å—Ç–æ–ª–∏–∫, –±—É–¥—å –ª–∞—Å–∫–∞
- **Ave»õi o masƒÉ cu vedere?** ‚Äî –£ –≤–∞—Å —î —Å—Ç–æ–ª–∏–∫ –∑ –≤–∏–¥–æ–º?

### –ó–∞–º–æ–≤–ª–µ–Ω–Ω—è

| –†—É–º—É–Ω—Å—å–∫–∞ | –£–∫—Ä–∞—ó–Ω—Å—å–∫–∞ |
|-----------|------------|
| Meniul, vƒÉ rog | –ú–µ–Ω—é, –±—É–¥—å –ª–∞—Å–∫–∞ |
| Ce ne recomanda»õi? | –©–æ –ø–æ—Ä–∞–¥–∏—Ç–µ? |
| Care este specialitatea casei? | –Ø–∫–∞ —Ñ—ñ—Ä–º–æ–≤–∞ —Å—Ç—Ä–∞–≤–∞? |
| Pentru mine... | –î–ª—è –º–µ–Ω–µ... |
| De bƒÉut a»ô vrea... | –ó –Ω–∞–ø–æ—ó–≤ —è –± —Ö–æ—Ç—ñ–≤/—Ö–æ—Ç—ñ–ª–∞... |

### –ö–æ—Ä–∏—Å–Ω—ñ —Ñ—Ä–∞–∑–∏

- **Este delicios!** ‚Äî –¶–µ —Å–º–∞—á–Ω–æ!
- **Nota de platƒÉ, vƒÉ rog** ‚Äî –†–∞—Ö—É–Ω–æ–∫, –±—É–¥—å –ª–∞—Å–∫–∞
- **Putem √ÆmpƒÉr»õi?** ‚Äî –ú–æ–∂–µ–º–æ —Ä–æ–∑–¥—ñ–ª–∏—Ç–∏?
- **PƒÉstra»õi restul** ‚Äî –ó–¥–∞—á—É –∑–∞–ª–∏—à—ñ—Ç—å —Å–æ–±—ñ

## –í –∫—ñ–Ω–æ—Ç–µ–∞—Ç—Ä—ñ

- **Ce film vrei sƒÉ vedem?** ‚Äî –Ø–∫–∏–π —Ñ—ñ–ª—å–º —Ö–æ—á–µ—à –ø–æ–¥–∏–≤–∏—Ç–∏—Å—è?
- **DouƒÉ bilete, vƒÉ rog** ‚Äî –î–≤–∞ –∫–≤–∏—Ç–∫–∏, –±—É–¥—å –ª–∞—Å–∫–∞
- **Unde vrei sƒÉ stƒÉm?** ‚Äî –î–µ —Ö–æ—á–µ—à —Å—ñ—Å—Ç–∏?
- **CumpƒÉrƒÉm popcorn?** ‚Äî –ö—É–ø–∏–º–æ –ø–æ–ø–∫–æ—Ä–Ω?
- **Filmul a fost minunat** ‚Äî –§—ñ–ª—å–º –±—É–≤ —á—É–¥–æ–≤–∏–π

## –ù–∞ –ø—Ä–æ–≥—É–ª—è–Ω—Ü—ñ

### –ó–∞–ø—Ä–æ—à–µ–Ω–Ω—è

- **Mergem la o plimbare?** ‚Äî –ü—ñ–¥–µ–º–æ –ø–æ–≥—É–ª—è—î–º–æ?
- **Hai sƒÉ facem o plimbare** ‚Äî –î–∞–≤–∞–π –ø—Ä–æ–≥—É–ª—è—î–º–æ—Å—å
- **Ai chef sƒÉ ne plimbƒÉm pu»õin?** ‚Äî –•–æ—á–µ—à —Ç—Ä–æ—Ö–∏ –ø—Ä–æ–≥—É–ª—è—Ç–∏—Å—è?

### –ü—ñ–¥ —á–∞—Å –ø—Ä–æ–≥—É–ª—è–Ω–∫–∏

- **Ce searƒÉ frumoasƒÉ!** ‚Äî –Ø–∫–∏–π –≥–∞—Ä–Ω–∏–π –≤–µ—á—ñ—Ä!
- **UitƒÉ-te la stele!** ‚Äî –ü–æ–¥–∏–≤–∏—Å—å –Ω–∞ –∑—ñ—Ä–∫–∏!
- **√émi place sƒÉ fiu cu tine** ‚Äî –ú–µ–Ω—ñ –ø–æ–¥–æ–±–∞—î—Ç—å—Å—è –±—É—Ç–∏ –∑ —Ç–æ–±–æ—é
- **Hai sƒÉ stƒÉm aici** ‚Äî –î–∞–≤–∞–π —Å—è–¥–µ–º–æ —Ç—É—Ç
- **Vrei o √Ænghe»õatƒÉ?** ‚Äî –•–æ—á–µ—à –º–æ—Ä–æ–∑–∏–≤–æ?

## –í –±–∞—Ä—ñ / –∫–∞–≤'—è—Ä–Ω—ñ

### –ó–∞–º–æ–≤–ª–µ–Ω–Ω—è –Ω–∞–ø–æ—ó–≤

| –ù–∞–ø—ñ–π | –†—É–º—É–Ω—Å—å–∫–∞ |
|-------|-----------|
| –ö–∞–≤–∞ | o cafea |
| –ö–∞–ø—É—á—ñ–Ω–æ | un cappuccino |
| –í–∏–Ω–æ | un pahar de vin |
| –ü–∏–≤–æ | o bere |
| –ö–æ–∫—Ç–µ–π–ª—å | un cocktail |
| –í–æ–¥–∞ | o sticlƒÉ de apƒÉ |

### –¢–æ—Å—Ç–∏

- **Noroc!** (–ù–æ—Ä–æ–∫) ‚Äî –ë—É–¥—å–º–æ!
- **SƒÉ trƒÉim!** ‚Äî –•–∞–π –∂–∏–≤–µ–º–æ!
- **Pentru noi!** ‚Äî –ó–∞ –Ω–∞—Å!
- **Pentru dragostea noastrƒÉ!** ‚Äî –ó–∞ –Ω–∞—à–µ –∫–æ—Ö–∞–Ω–Ω—è!
- **Pentru sƒÉnƒÉtate!** ‚Äî –ó–∞ –∑–¥–æ—Ä–æ–≤'—è!

## –¢—Ä–∞–¥–∏—Ü—ñ–π–Ω—ñ —Ä—É–º—É–Ω—Å—å–∫—ñ –Ω–∞–ø–æ—ó

- **»öuicƒÉ** (–¶—É–π–∫–µ) ‚Äî –°–ª–∏–≤–æ–≤–∞ —Ä–∞–∫—ñ—è
- **PalincƒÉ** (–ü–∞–ª—ñ–Ω–∫–µ) ‚Äî –§—Ä—É–∫—Ç–æ–≤–∞ —Ä–∞–∫—ñ—è (—Å–∏–ª—å–Ω—ñ—à–∞)
- **Vin fiert** ‚Äî –ì–ª—ñ–Ω—Ç–≤–µ–π–Ω

**–£–≤–∞–≥–∞:** »öuicƒÉ –¥—É–∂–µ –º—ñ—Ü–Ω–∞! –ü–∏–π—Ç–µ –æ–±–µ—Ä–µ–∂–Ω–æ.

## –ù–∞ –∫–æ–Ω—Ü–µ—Ä—Ç—ñ / –≤ —Ç–µ–∞—Ç—Ä—ñ

- **√é»õi place muzica?** ‚Äî –¢–æ–±—ñ –ø–æ–¥–æ–±–∞—î—Ç—å—Å—è –º—É–∑–∏–∫–∞?
- **Ce spectacol frumos!** ‚Äî –Ø–∫–∏–π –≥–∞—Ä–Ω–∏–π —Å–ø–µ–∫—Ç–∞–∫–ª—å!
- **Artistul este foarte talentat** ‚Äî –ê—Ä—Ç–∏—Å—Ç –¥—É–∂–µ —Ç–∞–ª–∞–Ω–æ–≤–∏—Ç–∏–π
- **CumpƒÉrƒÉm un suvenir?** ‚Äî –ö—É–ø–∏–º–æ —Å—É–≤–µ–Ω—ñ—Ä?

## –ó–∞–≤–µ—Ä—à–µ–Ω–Ω—è –≤–µ—á–æ—Ä–∞

### –ö–æ–º–ø–ª—ñ–º–µ–Ω—Ç–∏

- **Am petrecut o searƒÉ minunatƒÉ** ‚Äî –Ø –ø—Ä–æ–≤—ñ–≤/–ø—Ä–æ–≤–µ–ª–∞ —á—É–¥–æ–≤–∏–π –≤–µ—á—ñ—Ä
- **M-am distrat de minune** ‚Äî –ú–µ–Ω—ñ –±—É–ª–æ –¥—É–∂–µ –≤–µ—Å–µ–ª–æ
- **Ai fost fantastic/ƒÉ** ‚Äî –¢–∏ –±—É–≤/–±—É–ª–∞ —Ñ–∞–Ω—Ç–∞—Å—Ç–∏—á–Ω–∏–π/—Ñ–∞–Ω—Ç–∞—Å—Ç–∏—á–Ω–∞
- **A fost o searƒÉ perfectƒÉ** ‚Äî –¶–µ –±—É–≤ —ñ–¥–µ–∞–ª—å–Ω–∏–π –≤–µ—á—ñ—Ä

### –ü–ª–∞–Ω–∏ –Ω–∞ –º–∞–π–±—É—Ç–Ω—î

- **C√¢nd ne revedem?** ‚Äî –ö–æ–ª–∏ –ø–æ–±–∞—á–∏–º–æ—Å—å?
- **Hai sƒÉ repetƒÉm cur√¢nd** ‚Äî –î–∞–≤–∞–π –ø–æ–≤—Ç–æ—Ä–∏–º–æ —Å–∫–æ—Ä–æ
- **Data viitoare aleg eu locul** ‚Äî –ù–∞—Å—Ç—É–ø–Ω–æ–≥–æ —Ä–∞–∑—É —è –æ–±–∏—Ä–∞—é –º—ñ—Å—Ü–µ
- **Te sun m√¢ine** ‚Äî –ü–æ–¥–∑–≤–æ–Ω—é —Ç–æ–±—ñ –∑–∞–≤—Ç—Ä–∞

## –†–æ–º–∞–Ω—Ç–∏—á–Ω—ñ —Ñ—Ä–∞–∑–∏ –Ω–∞ –∫—ñ–Ω–µ—Ü—å –≤–µ—á–æ—Ä–∞

- **Nu vreau ca aceastƒÉ searƒÉ sƒÉ se termine** ‚Äî –ù–µ —Ö–æ—á—É, —â–æ–± —Ü–µ–π –≤–µ—á—ñ—Ä –∑–∞–∫—ñ–Ω—á—É–≤–∞–≤—Å—è
- **Mul»õumesc pentru aceastƒÉ searƒÉ frumoasƒÉ** ‚Äî –î—è–∫—É—é –∑–∞ —Ü–µ–π —á—É–¥–æ–≤–∏–π –≤–µ—á—ñ—Ä
- **E»ôti persoana cu care vreau sƒÉ fiu** ‚Äî –¢–∏ —Ç–∞ –ª—é–¥–∏–Ω–∞, –∑ —è–∫–æ—é —è —Ö–æ—á—É –±—É—Ç–∏
- **Te conduc acasƒÉ** ‚Äî –ü—Ä–æ–≤–µ–¥—É —Ç–µ–±–µ –¥–æ–¥–æ–º—É
- **Vise frumoase, iubirea mea** ‚Äî –ì–∞—Ä–Ω–∏—Ö —Å–Ω—ñ–≤, –º–æ—è –ª—é–±–æ–≤

## –ö—É–ª—å—Ç—É—Ä–Ω–∞ –ø–æ—Ä–∞–¥–∞

–†—É–º—É–Ω–∏ —Ü—ñ–Ω—É—é—Ç—å:
- –ì–∞–ª–∞–Ω—Ç–Ω—ñ—Å—Ç—å ‚Äî –≤—ñ–¥–∫—Ä–∏–π—Ç–µ –¥–≤–µ—Ä—ñ, –¥–æ–ø–æ–º–æ–∂—ñ—Ç—å –∑ –ø–∞–ª—å—Ç–æ–º
- –ö–æ–º–ø–ª–∏–º–µ–Ω—Ç–∏ ‚Äî –Ω–µ —Å–æ—Ä–æ–º—Ç–µ—Å—è —Ö–≤–∞–ª–∏—Ç–∏
- –ß–∞—Å —Ä–∞–∑–æ–º ‚Äî –Ω–µ –ø–æ—Å–ø—ñ—à–∞–π—Ç–µ
- –¢—Ä–∞–¥–∏—Ü—ñ—ó ‚Äî –ø—Ä–∏–π–º—ñ—Ç—å —Ü—É–π–∫—É, —è–∫—â–æ –ø—Ä–æ–ø–æ–Ω—É—é—Ç—å (—Ö–æ—á–∞ –± —Ç—Ä–æ—Ö–∏)

SearƒÉ plƒÉcutƒÉ! –ì–∞—Ä–Ω–æ–≥–æ –≤–µ—á–æ—Ä–∞!

## –ü—Ä–∞–∫—Ç–∏–∫—É–π—Ç–µ —Ä—É–º—É–Ω—Å—å–∫—É –¥–ª—è –ø–æ–±–∞—á–µ–Ω—å

–ü—Ä–∞–∫—Ç–∏–∫—É–π—Ç–µ —Ä—É–º—É–Ω—Å—å–∫—É –¥–ª—è –ø–æ–±–∞—á–µ–Ω—å –∑ AI-—Å–ø—ñ–≤—Ä–æ–∑–º–æ–≤–Ω–∏–∫–æ–º: –≥–æ–ª–æ—Å–æ–≤—ñ –¥—ñ–∞–ª–æ–≥–∏ –≤ —Ä–µ–∞–ª—å–Ω–æ–º—É —á–∞—Å—ñ, –æ—Å–æ–±–∏—Å—Ç–∏–π —Å–ª–æ–≤–Ω–∏–∫ Love Log —ñ –º–æ–∂–ª–∏–≤—ñ—Å—Ç—å –¥–∞—Ä—É–≤–∞—Ç–∏ –∫–æ—Ö–∞–Ω–∏–º —Å–ª–æ–≤–∞ Word Gifts. 306 –º–æ–≤–Ω–∏—Ö –ø–∞—Ä –¥–ª—è –±–∞–≥–∞—Ç–æ–º–æ–≤–Ω–∏—Ö —Å—Ç–æ—Å—É–Ω–∫—ñ–≤.

[–ü–æ—á–∞—Ç–∏ –ø—Ä–∞–∫—Ç–∏–∫—É –±–µ–∑–∫–æ—à—Ç–æ–≤–Ω–æ](https://lovelanguages.app)

articles.title: Polish Questions: How to Ask Anything
articles.content:
import VocabCard from '@components/VocabCard.astro';
import ConjugationTable from '@components/ConjugationTable.astro';
import CultureTip from '@components/CultureTip.astro';
import PhraseOfDay from '@components/PhraseOfDay.astro';
import CTA from '@components/CTA.astro';

Asking questions is fundamental to any relationship. In Polish, forming questions involves specific patterns and interrogative words that every couple should master. Whether you want to know what your partner is thinking or plan your next date, this guide will help you ask with confidence.

<PhraseOfDay
  polish="Co my≈õlisz?"
  english="What are you thinking?"
  pronunciation="tso MISH-lish"
  context="Perfect for intimate moments when you want to know what's on your partner's mind."
/>

## Polish Question Words (Interrogatives)

Polish question words are the foundation of asking anything. Here are the essential ones every couple needs:

| Polish | English | Pronunciation | Usage |
|---|---|---|---|
| Co? | What? | tso | Things, objects, activities |
| Kto? | Who? | kto | People |
| Gdzie? | Where? | g-DJEH | Places, locations |
| Kiedy? | When? | KYEH-di | Time |
| Dlaczego? | Why? | dla-CHEH-go | Reasons |
| Jak? | How? | yak | Manner, way |
| Ile? | How much/many? | EE-leh | Quantity |
| Kt√≥ry? | Which? | KTOO-ri | Selection from options |

<VocabCard
  polish="Gdzie jeste≈õ?"
  english="Where are you?"
  pronunciation="g-DJEH YESH-tesh"
  example="Gdzie jeste≈õ, kochanie? Czekam na ciebie."
/>

## Basic Question Formation

Polish has two main ways to form questions:

### 1. Using Question Words
Place the interrogative word at the beginning, followed by normal word order:
- **Co robisz?** (What are you doing?)
- **Gdzie idziesz?** (Where are you going?)
- **Kiedy wr√≥cisz?** (When will you return?)

### 2. Yes/No Questions
Add **czy** (whether/if) at the beginning, or simply use rising intonation:
- **Czy mnie kochasz?** (Do you love me?)
- **Kochasz mnie?** (You love me?) - with rising tone

<CultureTip title="Formal vs. Informal">
With your partner, always use the informal **ty** (you) form. The formal **Pan/Pani** is only for strangers or very formal situations.
</CultureTip>

## Essential Questions for Couples

### About Feelings and Emotions

<VocabCard
  polish="Jak siƒô czujesz?"
  english="How do you feel?"
  pronunciation="yak sheh CHOO-yesh"
  example="Jak siƒô czujesz po naszej rozmowie?"
/>

- **Co ciƒô martwi?** (What's worrying you?)
- **Dlaczego jeste≈õ smutny/smutna?** (Why are you sad?) - smutny for masculine, smutna for feminine
- **O czym my≈õlisz?** (What are you thinking about?)
- **Czy jeste≈õ szczƒô≈õliwy/szczƒô≈õliwa?** (Are you happy?)

### About Daily Life and Plans

- **Co robi≈Çe≈õ/robi≈Ça≈õ dzisiaj?** (What did you do today?)
- **Gdzie chcesz i≈õƒá jutro?** (Where do you want to go tomorrow?)
- **O kt√≥rej godzinie?** (At what time?)
- **Z kim siƒô spotka≈Çe≈õ/spotka≈Ça≈õ?** (Who did you meet with?)

### About the Relationship

- **Czy mnie kochasz?** (Do you love me?)
- **Jak d≈Çugo jeste≈õmy razem?** (How long have we been together?)
- **Co lubisz we mnie najbardziej?** (What do you like most about me?)
- **Jakie masz plany na przysz≈Ço≈õƒá?** (What are your plans for the future?)

## Advanced Question Patterns

### Questions with Prepositions

Many Polish questions use prepositions that must match the case system:

- **O czym rozmawiasz?** (What are you talking about?) - **o** + locative case
- **Z kim idziesz?** (Who are you going with?) - **z** + instrumental case
- **Do kogo dzwonisz?** (Who are you calling?) - **do** + genitive case

<VocabCard
  polish="Na co czekasz?"
  english="What are you waiting for?"
  pronunciation="na tso CHEH-kash"
  example="Na co czekasz? Chod≈∫my ju≈º!"
/>

### Complex Questions

As you advance, you can form more sophisticated questions:

- **Dlaczego nie powiedzia≈Çe≈õ/powiedzia≈Ça≈õ mi wcze≈õniej?** (Why didn't you tell me earlier?)
- **Jak my≈õlisz, czy to dobry pomys≈Ç?** (What do you think, is this a good idea?)
- **Kt√≥re miejsce wola≈Çby≈õ/wola≈Çaby≈õ odwiedziƒá?** (Which place would you prefer to visit?)

## Question Intonation

Polish question intonation is crucial for natural communication:

### Rising Intonation
Used for yes/no questions:
- **Jeste≈õ g≈Çodny?** ‚Üó (Are you hungry?)
- **Idziemy na spacer?** ‚Üó (Shall we go for a walk?)

### Falling Intonation
Used with question words:
- **Gdzie jeste≈õ?** ‚Üò (Where are you?)
- **Co robimy?** ‚Üò (What are we doing?)

<CultureTip title="Cultural Note">
Poles appreciate directness in relationships. Don't hesitate to ask what's on your mind - it shows you care and want to understand your partner better.
</CultureTip>

## Common Question Mistakes to Avoid

1. **Word Order**: Don't translate directly from English. "What you are doing?" becomes **"Co robisz?"** not "Co ty robisz?"

2. **Gender Agreement**: Remember that adjectives must agree with gender:
   - **Czy jeste≈õ gotowy?** (Are you ready? - to a male)
   - **Czy jeste≈õ gotowa?** (Are you ready? - to a female)

3. **Case System**: Question words change based on their grammatical function:
   - **Kto to jest?** (Who is it?) - nominative
   - **Kogo widzisz?** (Who do you see?) - accusative

## Practice Conversations

Here are some natural dialogue patterns:

**Planning a Date:**
- A: **Co chcia≈Çby≈õ/chcia≈Çaby≈õ robiƒá dzi≈õ wieczorem?** (What would you like to do this evening?)
- B: **Mo≈ºe p√≥jdziemy do kina?** (Maybe we'll go to the cinema?)
- A: **Na jaki film?** (To what movie?)

**Getting to Know Each Other:**
- A: **Jakie jest twoje ulubione jedzenie?** (What's your favorite food?)
- B: **Uwielbiam pierogi. A ty?** (I love pierogi. And you?)
- A: **Jak je przygotowujesz?** (How do you prepare them?)

## Softening Questions

To make questions gentler, use these phrases:

- **Czy m√≥g≈Çbym/mog≈Çabym zapytaƒá...?** (Could I ask...?)
- **Przepraszam, ale...** (Excuse me, but...)
- **Czy mo≈ºesz mi powiedzieƒá...?** (Can you tell me...?)
- **Interesuje mnie...** (I'm interested in...)

<VocabCard
  polish="Czy mo≈ºesz mi wyja≈õniƒá?"
  english="Can you explain to me?"
  pronunciation="chi MO-zhesh mee vi-ya-SHNYICH"
  example="Czy mo≈ºesz mi wyja≈õniƒá, dlaczego jeste≈õ z≈Çy?"
/>

Mastering Polish questions opens up deeper communication with your partner. Start with simple patterns and gradually build complexity. Remember, asking questions shows you care about understanding your loved one better.


<CTA
  text="Ready to Practice Polish Questions?"
  buttonText="Start Learning"
/>

articles.title: Frases en H√∫ngaro para tu Primera Cita
articles.content:
Las citas con h√∫ngaros combinan pasi√≥n y misterio. Estas frases te ayudar√°n.

## Frases para Romper el Hielo

### "Nagyon √∂r√ºl√∂k, hogy v√©gre tal√°lkozhatok veled"
**Pronunciaci√≥n:** NA-dyon √ñ-r√º-l√∂k hody VEG-re ta-LAL-koz-ha-tok VE-led

**Significado:** Me alegro mucho de conocerte por fin

### "Csod√°latosan n√©zel ki"

**Significado:** Te ves maravilloso/a

### "Nagyon v√°rtam ezt a pillanatot"

## Frases para Conocerse

### "Mes√©lj magadr√≥l"
**Pronunciaci√≥n:** ME-shelj MA-gad-rol

### "Mit szeretsz csin√°lni szabadid≈ëdben?"

### "Mi a kedvenc...?"

## Frases Rom√°nticas

### "Nagyon √©lvezem ezt"
**Pronunciaci√≥n:** NA-dyon EL-ve-zem est

**Significado:** Disfruto mucho esto

### "Gy√∂ny√∂r≈± a mosolyod"
**Pronunciaci√≥n:** DY√ñ-ny√∂-r√º a MO-sho-yod

**Significado:** Tu sonrisa es preciosa

### "Nagyon j√≥l √©rzem magam veled"
**Pronunciaci√≥n:** NA-dyon yol ER-zem MA-gam VE-led

**Significado:** Me siento muy bien contigo

## Frases para Terminar

### "Csod√°latos este volt"
**Pronunciaci√≥n:** cho-DA-la-tosh ESH-te volt

**Significado:** Fue una noche maravillosa

### "Tal√°lkozhatunk √∫jra?"
**Pronunciaci√≥n:** ta-LAL-koz-ha-tunk UY-ra

**Significado:** ¬øPodemos vernos de nuevo?

### "√çrj, ha haza√©rt√©l"
**Pronunciaci√≥n:** Iry ha HA-za-er-tel

**Significado:** Escr√≠beme cuando llegues a casa

## Conclusi√≥n

Las citas h√∫ngaras son √∫nicas y memorables.

articles.title: Rusk√° v√Ωslovnost pro zaƒç√°teƒçn√≠ky: Jak mluvit s l√°skou
articles.content:
import VocabCard from '@components/VocabCard.astro';
import ConjugationTable from '@components/ConjugationTable.astro';
import CultureTip from '@components/CultureTip.astro';
import PhraseOfDay from '@components/PhraseOfDay.astro';
import CTA from '@components/CTA.astro';

P≈ôedstavte si, jak v√°≈° partner z√°≈ô√≠, kdy≈æ poprv√© usly≈°√≠, jak ≈ô√≠k√°te "ja ljublju tebja" (miluji tƒõ) s perfektn√≠ ruskou v√Ωslovnost√≠. Spr√°vn√° v√Ωslovnost je kl√≠ƒçov√° pro romantick√© okam≈æiky a hlub≈°√≠ spojen√≠ s va≈°√≠m milovan√Ωm. Tato p≈ô√≠ruƒçka v√°s nauƒç√≠ z√°klady rusk√© v√Ωslovnosti pomoc√≠ fr√°z√≠, kter√© skuteƒçnƒõ pou≈æijete ve va≈°em vztahu.

<PhraseOfDay
  word="–°–ø–∞—Å–∏–±–æ"
  translation="Dƒõkuji"
  pronunciation="spah-SEE-bah"
  context="Z√°kladn√≠ slu≈°nost - pou≈æijte, kdy≈æ v√°≈° partner nƒõco udƒõl√° pro v√°s."
/>

## Proƒç je rusk√° v√Ωslovnost jin√°?

Rusk√° v√Ωslovnost m≈Ø≈æe p≈Øsobit jako v√Ωzva, ale nebojte se! Na rozd√≠l od ƒçe≈°tiny m√° ru≈°tina nƒõkolik unik√°tn√≠ch zvuk≈Ø. Kl√≠ƒçem je procviƒçovat spoleƒçnƒõ a sm√°t se drobn√Ωm chyb√°m.

### Z√°kladn√≠ rozd√≠ly:
- **Tvrd√© a mƒõkk√© souhl√°sky** - jako v ƒçe≈°tinƒõ, ale je≈°tƒõ d≈Øle≈æitƒõj≈°√≠
- **P≈ô√≠zvuk** - v≈ædy na jedn√© slabice, mƒõn√≠ v√Ωznam slov
- **P√≠smeno "—ã"** - zvl√°≈°tn√≠ zvuk, kter√Ω nem√°me

## 5 kl√≠ƒçov√Ωch zvuk≈Ø, kter√© mus√≠te zn√°t

### 1. P√≠smeno "–´" - tajemn√Ω zvuk

<VocabCard
  word="–°—ã–Ω"
  translation="Syn"
  pronunciation="sihn"
  example="–£ –º–µ–Ω—è –µ—Å—Ç—å —Å—ã–Ω."
/>

Tento zvuk vytvo≈ô√≠te tak, ≈æe se sna≈æ√≠te ≈ô√≠ct "i", ale jazyk dr≈æ√≠te vzadu v √∫stech jako p≈ôi "u". Zn√≠ to jako nƒõco mezi "i" a "u".

### 2. Mƒõkk√© znam√©nko "–¨"

Mƒõkk√© znam√©nko zjem≈àuje p≈ôedchoz√≠ souhl√°sku, ale **nesamostatnƒõ vyslovuje**:

| Slovo | V√Ωslovnost | V√Ωznam |
|-------|------------|--------|
| **–ú–∞—Ç—å** | maht' | Matka |
| **–ë—Ä–∞—Ç** | braht | Bratr |
| **–ü–∏—Ç—å** | peet' | P√≠t |

### 3. Tvrd√© "–®" vs. mƒõkk√© "–©"

- **–®** (≈°) - jako v ƒçe≈°tinƒõ "≈°"
- **–©** (≈°ƒç) - del≈°√≠, mƒõkƒç√≠ zvuk "≈°ƒç"

<VocabCard
  word="–©—É–∫–∞"
  translation="≈†tika"
  pronunciation="schoo-KAH"
  example="–©—É–∫–∞ - –±–æ–ª—å—à–∞—è —Ä—ã–±–∞."
/>

### 4. Vok√°l "–≠"

P√≠smeno **–≠** vyslovujte jako **tvrd√© "e"** jako v anglick√©m "bed":

| Slovo | V√Ωslovnost | V√Ωznam |
|-------|------------|--------|
| **–≠—Ç–æ** | EH-toh | To/tohle |
| **–¢–µ—Ç—è** | TYEH-tyah | Teta |

### 5. P≈ô√≠zvuk je kl√≠ƒçov√Ω!

V ru≈°tinƒõ **m≈Ø≈æe p≈ô√≠zvuk zmƒõnit v√Ωznam**:

<CultureTip title="üá∑üá∫ P≈ô√≠zvuk mƒõn√≠ v≈°e!" >
Slovo **–∑–∞ÃÅ–º–æ–∫** (Z√Å-mok) = hrad
Slovo **–∑–∞–º–æÃÅ–∫** (za-M√ìK) = z√°mek
Stejn√© p√≠smena, jin√Ω v√Ωznam! V≈ædy poslouchejte rodil√© mluvƒç√≠.
</CultureTip>

## Romantick√° slov√≠ƒçka k procviƒçen√≠

Procviƒçujte spoleƒçnƒõ s tƒõmito [l√°skypln√Ωmi fr√°zemi](/learn/cs/ru/romantic-phrases-for-every-occasion/):

| Ru≈°tina | ƒåe≈°tina | V√Ωslovnost | Pou≈æit√≠ |
|---------|---------|------------|---------|
| **–õ—é–±–æ–≤—å** | L√°ska | lyoo-BOHF' | "–≠—Ç–æ –ª—é–±–æ–≤—å!" (To je l√°ska!) |
| **–†–∞–¥–æ—Å—Ç—å** | Radost | RAH-dost' | "–¢—ã –º–æ—è —Ä–∞–¥–æ—Å—Ç—å!" (Jsi m√° radost!) |
| **–°—á–∞—Å—Ç—å–µ** | ≈†tƒõst√≠ | SCHAH-st'yeh | "–¢—ã –º–æ—ë —Å—á–∞—Å—Ç—å–µ!" (Jsi moje ≈°tƒõst√≠!) |
| **–ü–æ—Ü–µ–ª—É–π** | Polibek | pah-tseh-LOOY | "–î–∞–π –º–Ω–µ –ø–æ—Ü–µ–ª—É–π!" (Dej mi polibek!) |

## P≈ô√≠zvukov√° pravidla v praxi

### Kde d√°vat p≈ô√≠zvuk?

1. **Na prvn√≠ slabiku** - nejbƒõ≈ænƒõj≈°√≠
2. **Na posledn√≠ slabiku** - u sloves v minul√©m ƒçase
3. **Na p≈ôedposledn√≠** - u nƒõkter√Ωch slov

<ConjugationTable
  verb="–ì–æ–≤–æ—Ä–∏—Ç—å"
  meaning="mluvit"
  conjugations={[
    { person: "J√°", polish: "–≥–æ–≤–æ—Ä—é", english: "govary√∫" },
    { person: "Ty", polish: "–≥–æ–≤–æ—Ä–∏—à—å", english: "govar√≠sh" },
    { person: "On/Ona", polish: "–≥–æ–≤–æ—Ä–∏—Ç", english: "govar√≠t" },
    { person: "My", polish: "–≥–æ–≤–æ—Ä–∏–º", english: "govar√≠m" },
    { person: "Vy", polish: "–≥–æ–≤–æ—Ä–∏—Ç–µ", english: "govar√≠tye" },
    { person: "Oni", polish: "–≥–æ–≤–æ—Ä—è—Ç", english: "govary√°t" }
  ]}
/>

## Fr√°ze pro ka≈æd√Ω den

Nauƒçte se tyto fr√°ze a procviƒçujte je spolu:

1. **–î–æ–±—Ä–æ–µ —É—Ç—Ä–æ** (dobrah-ye OO-trah) - Dobr√© r√°no
2. **–°–ø–æ–∫–æ–π–Ω–æ–π –Ω–æ—á–∏** (spah-KOH-ee-nuy NOH-chee) - Dobrou noc
3. **–ö–∞–∫ –¥–µ–ª–∞?** (kak dyeh-LAH?) - Jak se m√°≈°?
4. **–Ø —Å–∫—É—á–∞—é** (yah skoo-CHAH-yoo) - St√Ωsk√° se mi
5. **–î–æ —Å–≤–∏–¥–∞–Ω–∏—è** (dah svee-DAH-nee-yah) - Na shledanou

<CultureTip title="üá∑üá∫ Milostn√° pravidla v√Ωslovnosti" >
Kdy≈æ ≈ô√≠k√°te **[miluji tƒõ v ru≈°tinƒõ](/learn/cs/ru/how-to-say-i-love-you-in-russian/)**, vyslovujte "ja ljublju tebja" pomalu a z≈ôetelnƒõ. Rusov√© vƒõnuj√≠ zvl√°≈°tn√≠ pozornost v√Ωslovnosti romantick√Ωch fr√°z√≠!
</CultureTip>

## Nejƒçastƒõj≈°√≠ chyby ƒåech≈Ø

### 1. Zamƒõna "–´" za "–ò"
**≈†PATNƒö**: "m…™luji" (s …™)
**SPR√ÅVNƒö**: "ja ljublju" (s —ã)

### 2. Ignorov√°n√≠ mƒõkk√©ho znam√©nka
**≈†PATNƒö**: "mat"
**SPR√ÅVNƒö**: "mat'" (matka)

### 3. Nespr√°vn√Ω p≈ô√≠zvuk
**≈†PATNƒö**: "za-M√ìK" (pro hrad)
**SPR√ÅVNƒö**: "Z√Å-mok"

## Rychl√° n√°povƒõda

### Z√°kladn√≠ abeceda s v√Ωslovnost√≠

| P√≠smeno | V√Ωslovnost | Podobn√© v ƒçe≈°tinƒõ |
|---------|------------|-------------------|
| –ê –∞ | ah | A jako v "mama" |
| –ë –± | beh | B |
| –í –≤ | veh | V |
| –ì –≥ | geh | G |
| –î –¥ | deh | D |
| –ï –µ | yeh | Je |
| –Å —ë | yoh | Jo |
| –ñ –∂ | zheh | ≈Ω |
| –ó –∑ | zeh | Z |
| –ò –∏ | ee | I dlouh√© |

## Procviƒçovac√≠ vƒõty pro p√°ry

Vyzkou≈°ejte tyto vƒõty spolu:

1. **–¢—ã –∫—Ä–∞—Å–∏–≤–∞—è** (tyh kra-SEE-vah-yah) - Jsi kr√°sn√°
2. **–¢—ã —É–º–Ω—ã–π** (tyh OOM-niy) - Jsi chytr√Ω
3. **–Ø —Ç–µ–±—è –ª—é–±–ª—é** (yah tyeh-BYAH lyoo-BLYOO) - Miluji tƒõ
4. **–¢—ã –º–æ—ë —Å–æ–ª–Ω—Ü–µ** (tyh mah-YOH SOHN-tseh) - Jsi moje slunce
5. **–° —Ç–æ–±–æ–π —Ö–æ—Ä–æ—à–æ** (s tah-BOHY khah-rah-SHOH) - Je mi s tebou dob≈ôe

Chcete v√≠c romantick√Ωch n√°pad≈Ø? Pod√≠vejte se na [slovn√≠ƒçek pro rande v ru≈°tinƒõ](/learn/cs/ru/russian-date-night-vocabulary/).

## Kam d√°l?

Nyn√≠, kdy≈æ zvl√°d√°te z√°klady v√Ωslovnosti, jste p≈ôipraveni na:
- [Z√°kladn√≠ fr√°ze pro p√°ry](/learn/cs/ru/essential-russian-phrases-for-couples/)
- [Rusk√° mazliv√° jm√©na](/learn/cs/ru/russian-pet-names-for-your-partner/)
- P≈ôiv√≠t√°n√≠ a rozlouƒçen√≠ v ru≈°tinƒõ

<CTA />
